parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of items to retrieve in a single request. **Example:** `10`. **Default:** `20`

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `dataId,dataTypeId,organizationId`

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on data source objects.
**Example:** `dataId`, `dataTypeId`, `hubId`, etc.
**Default:** `createdTime`

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description:
Name or unique identifier value associated with data source. You can do a multipe filter `dataId` using separator coma (,)
**Example:** `Outlet` or `Outlet,Toko`

parameters.name: dataTypeId
parameters.description:
The identifier for Data Type. Use GET /data-types API to get the list of Data Type IDs.
**Example:** `63db2fb476bc679c540369c4`

parameters.name: dataTypeName
parameters.description:
Name of data type. Use GET /data-types API to get the list of dataType Name.
**Example:** `Pegawai`

parameters.name: updatedTime
parameters.description:
The time at which the data is updated.
**Example:** `2023-07-06T06:41:08`

parameters.name: limitUser
parameters.description:
Parameter to restrict data source based on user. The default value of this parameter is true. If `limitUser` is true, the data source will be limited based on user. and if `limitUser` is false, data source will show all data without any limitation based on user.
**Example:** `false`

post.description: When creating a new datasource, the payload includes dynamic keys whose structure is determined by the data type specified by dataTypeId. To understand which fields are required and their respective types, you must first retrieve the schema of the data type from the endpoint GET /data-type/{dataTypeId}. The response from this endpoint defines the additional dynamic keys needed in the payload beyond the standard fields such as dataId, dataTypeId, and hubId. For example, if the dataTypeId refers to an outlet or store, the /data-type/{dataTypeId} endpoint might return a schema that specifies keys like outletName, outletHours, outletType, etc. These fields and their types (string, integer, boolean, etc.) must be included in the request payload when creating the datasource.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the data that generated by system.
**Example**: `63dc641b1ed1fd63ad0c9013`

get.summary: Read data source by dataTypeName and dataId

parameters.name: dataTypeName
parameters.description:
Name of data type.
Use GET /data-types API to get the list of dataType Name.
**Example:** `Pegawai`

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description:
Primary key data of the data type.
Use GET /data API to get the list primary key data of dataType.
**Example:** `anas`

Use GET /data API to get the list primary key data of dataType.
**Example:** `anas`

post.summary: Bulk create or update data source

success.description: Total success created or update data source.

failed.description: Total failed created or update data source.

data.description: Detail of created or update data source.

message.description: Message of create or update data source

event.description: The type of action performed on the data source, either `create` or `update`
